src package¶

Submodules¶

src.equation_handler module¶

class src.equation_handler.EquationHandler[source]¶

Bases: object

Class designed for numeric operations based on Lorenz and Roessler attractors theorem

Attributes

constantslor - lorenz constants array constantsroe - roessler constants array

Methods

set_lorenz_conditions(self, rho, beta, sigma) - Sets Lorenz rho, beta & sigma parameters of constantsl array to given values

lorenz(self, xyz) - Calculates difference quotients based on Lorenz attractor equations to be used in Runge-Kutta algorithm

set_roessler_conditions(self, a, b, c) - Sets Roessler a, b & c parameters of constantsr array to given values

roessler(self, xyz) - Calculates difference quotients based on Roessler attractor equations to be used in Runge-Kutta algorithm

print_lorenz_eq(self, rho, beta, sigma) - Outputs Lorenz attractor equations in a legible form print_roessler_eq(self, a, b, c) - Outputs Roessler attractor equations in a legible form

runge_kutta_algorithm_4_lorenz(self, initial_conditions, t_start, t_end, num_steps) - uses 4th order Runge-Kutta algorithm to solve Lorenz attractor equations numerically, calculating the XYZ points for Roessler attractor of given parameters

runge_kutta_algorithm_4_roessler(self, initial_conditions, t_start, t_end, num_steps) - uses 4th order Runge-Kutta algorithm to solve Roessler attractor equations numerically, calculating the XYZ points for Roessler attractor of given parameters

lorenz(xyz)[source]¶

Calculates difference quotients based on Lorenz attractor equations to be used in Runge-Kutta algorithm

Parameters:

xyz – temporary x, y, z values as an array

Returns:

array of difference quotients as an array

print_lorenz_eq(rho, beta, sigma)[source]¶

Outputs Lorenz attractor equations in a legible form

Parameters:

  • rho – rho parameter of Lorenz attractor equation

  • beta – beta parameter of Lorenz attractor equation

  • sigma – sigma parameter of Lorenz attractor equation

Returns:

string representation of Lorenz attractor equation

print_roessler_eq(a, b, c)[source]¶

Outputs Roessler attractor equations in a legible form

Parameters:

  • a – a parameter of Roessler attractor equation

  • b – b parameter of Roessler attractor equation

  • c – c parameter of Roessler attractor equation

Returns:

string representation of Roessler attractor equation

roessler(xyz)[source]¶

Calculates difference quotients based on Roessler attractor equations to be used in Runge-Kutta algorithm

Parameters:

xyz – temporary x, y, z values as an array

Returns:

array of difference quotients as an array

runge_kutta_algorithm_4_lorenz(init_conditions, t_start, t_end, num_steps)[source]¶

Uses 4th order Runge-Kutta algorithm to solve Lorenz attractor equations numerically, calculating the XYZ points for lorenz attractor of given parameters

Parameters:

  • init_conditions – initial XYZ values for Lorenz attractor

  • t_start – initial time for Lorenz attractor

  • t_end – end time for Lorenz attractor

  • num_steps – number of steps determining the density of points

Returns:

Array of evenly spaced numbers based on stop, start and step conditions, Array of XYZ points for Lorenz attractor of given parameters

runge_kutta_algorithm_4_roessler(init_conditions, t_start, t_end, num_steps)[source]¶

Uses 4th order Runge-Kutta algorithm to solve Roessler attractor equations numerically, calculating the XYZ points for Roessler attractor of given parameters

Parameters:

  • init_conditions – initial XYZ values for Roessler attractor

  • t_start – initial time for Roessler attractor

  • t_end – end time for Roessler attractor

  • num_steps – number of steps determining the density of points

Returns:

Array of evenly spaced numbers based on stop, start and step conditions, Array of XYZ points for Roessler attractor of given parameters

set_lorenz_conditions(rho, beta, sigma)[source]¶

Sets Lorenz rho, beta & sigma parameters of constantsl array to given values

Parameters:

  • rho – rho parameter of Lorenz attractor equation

  • beta – beta parameter of Lorenz attractor equation

  • sigma – sigma parameter of Lorenz attractor equation

Returns:

array of Lorenz parameters

set_roessler_conditions(a, b, c)[source]¶

Sets Roessler a, b & c parameters of constantsr array to given values

Parameters:

  • a – a parameter of Roessler attractor equation

  • b – b parameter of Roessler attractor equation

  • c – c parameter of Roessler attractor equation

Returns:

array of Roessler parameters

src.main module¶

class src.main.MainFrame[source]¶

Bases: QMainWindow

Attributes

term_handler - TerminalHandler class object used for command execution

text_edit - text send from terminal to Term_handler

sc - MplCanvas2D3D class object

eq_handler - EquationHandler class object used for numerical calculations of Lorenz and Roessler attractors equation

self.eq_type_flag - flag distinguishing between Lorenz (equation=0) and Roessler (equation=1) attractors display

lor_tmp - array of temporary parameter values of Lorenz attractor

lor_tmp - array of temporary parameter values of Roessler attractor

X,Y,Z - XYZ coordinates used for attractor plotting

lor_params_rho, lor_params_beta, lor_params_sigma - textfields representing Lorenz attractor parameters

roe_params_a, roe_params_b, roe_params_c - textfields representing Roessler attractor parameters

lor_init_condition_rho, lor_init_condition_beta, lor_init_condition_sigma - textfields representing Lorenz attractor starting conditions

self.roe_init_condition_a, self.roe_init_condition_b, self.roe_init_condition_c - textfields representing Lorenz attractor starting conditions

step_start - textfield representing starting step

step_stop - textfield representing last step

step_count - textfield representing number of steps

draw_noise_plots(t_num, X, Y, Z)[source]¶

Plots X, Y & Z noise in 2D as a function of time steps :param t_num: time steps array :param X: x coordinates array :param Y: y coordinates array :param Z: z coordinates array

get_user_Equation()[source]¶
initUI()[source]¶

Function initializes user interface setting up layouts, button and other widgets. It also displays and draws a number of plots related to Lorenz and Roessler attractors.

init_lorenz()[source]¶

Initializes Lorenz equation handler from textfields, displays information about step, equations and parameters and finally draws 3D plots of Lorenz equations.

init_roessler()[source]¶

Initializes Roessler equation handler from textfields, displays information about step, equations and parameters and finally draws 3D plots of Lorenz equations.

look_for_enter_key()[source]¶

Listens to commands entered into terminal passing thwem to Term_handler class methods

print_onto_text_edit(text)[source]¶

prints :param text:

class src.main.MplCanvas3D2D(width=20, height=20, dpi=100)[source]¶

Bases: FigureCanvasQTAgg

Class is a version of a basic PyQT FigureCanvas with modified plotting function meant for Lorenz and Roessler attractors plotting.

Atributes

figure - graph of given size and format

Methods

plot3D - Plots XYZ points on a 3D graph based on supplied arrays of coordinates plot2D - Plots XY points on 2D graph based on supplied arrays of coordinates

plot2D(xarray, yarray, xlabel, ylabel, color)[source]¶

Plots XY points on 2D graph based on supplied arrays of coordinates :param xarray: x coordinates array :param yarray: y coordinates array :param xlabel: label of OX axis :param ylabel: label of OY axis :param color: color of the plot

plot3D(xarray, yarray, zarray)[source]¶

Plots XYZ points on a 3D graph based on supplied arrays of coordinates :param xarray: x coordinates array :param yarray: y coordinates array :param zarray: z coordinates array

src.terminal_handler module¶

class src.terminal_handler.TerminalHandler(main_frame)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class used for execution and management of commands from text passed by terminal.

Attributes

main_frame - UI class object used for outside function execution

Methods

get_command(self, textedit, text) - determines if text matches any know command and assigns it value.

get_last_non_empty_line(self, lines) - cuts empty lines from user input.

check_command_type(self, commandNum, textedit) - determines what command should be executed.

load_command_base(self) - loads commands from .txt file

save_plot(self) - saves plot parameters to .txt file

load_plot(self) - loads plot parameters from .txt file

check_command_type(commandNum, textedit)[source]¶

Determines what command should be executed based on signal send by get_command()

Parameters:

  • commandNum (int) – signal send by get_command()

  • textedit – does nothing

get_command(textedit, text)[source]¶

Determines if text matches any know command and assigns it its enum value based on loaded CommandList

Parameters:

  • textedit – does nothing

  • text (string) – string to evaluate

Returns:

void

get_last_non_empty_line(lines)[source]¶

Cuts empty lines from user input.

Parameters:

lines (str) – input text from terminal

Returns:

last non-empty line

Return type:

str

load_command_base()[source]¶

Loads available commands from command_list.txt and transforms into an enum following pattern:

[enum string]->[enum iterator]

load_plot()[source]¶

Loads parameters from a previously saved saved_plots.txt file.

The parameters are saved in “0,0,0 /n” format by .save_plot() and can be used to recall previous results of the program.

save_plot()[source]¶

Saves given parameters from textfields to a saved_plots.txt file.

The parameters come from lorenz and roessler parameters & start conditions, as well as stop, start & step conditions, they are as saved as: ______________________________________________

rho,beta,sigma

initial X,initial Y, initial Z (for Lorenz)

a,b,c

initial X,initial Y, initial Z (for Roessler)

stary,stop,step

Module contents¶

Chaos
